status.Assigned: A curriculum assignment not yet started
status.Started: A curriculum assignment currently started but not marked complete
status.Complete: A curriculum assignment that has been marked complete

roadmapGroup.Now: Current focus of effort, attainable goal
roadmapGroup.Next: Things we think we will do next. A new 'now' will come from here
roadmapGroup.Later: Long term strategic goals or plans

title.Candidate: An Apprentice Candidate learning a full-stack
title.Apprentice: A software engineer gaining broad skills
title.Resident: A well-rounded software engineer with a grasp of technologies across all ITIL/ITSM domains and an area of Specialization
title.Master: A senior software engineer recognized as a leader within their specialty
title.Distinguished: A senior software engineer that has been recognized by their peers as a distinguished contributor

status.Matching: Completed introduction, waiting on mentor match
status.Active: Matched with a mentor and having regular encounters
status.Hold: Member who was active, initiated pause in mentor work
status.Inactive: Member who was active, has indicated that they are no long interested in mentorship services
status.TimedOut: Member did not schedule introduction call within 2-weeks.

device.Linux: Boots to Linux (dual boot or vm)

cadence.Every 2 Weeks: Meetings are once every two weeks

status.Inactive: A partner that has discontinued relationships

category.Foundations of ITSM: This category encompasses foundational knowledge and practices essential for effective IT service management.
category.Design and Development: In the ITIL framework, design and development align with the service design phase, where services and processes are designed to meet business requirements.
category.Infrastructure and Operations: Infrastructure and operations are key components of IT service delivery, encompassing hardware, operating systems, and cloud infrastructure.
category.Networking and Security: Networking and security are essential aspects of IT service management, ensuring the availability, integrity, and confidentiality of IT services and data.
category.Development Tools and Practices: Development tools and practices support the software development lifecycle, from code creation to deployment and maintenance.
category.Data Management: Data management encompasses the storage, manipulation, and analysis of data to support business operations and decision-making.
category.Continuous Integration and Deployment: Continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) practices automate the process of building, testing, and deploying software changes.
category.Monitoring and Performance: Monitoring and performance management ensure the availability, reliability, and performance of IT services.

mastery.Candidate: An Apprentice Candidate learning a full-stack
mastery.Apprentice: A software engineer gaining broad skills
mastery.Resident: A well-rounded software engineer with a grasp of technologies across all ITIL/ITSM domains and an area of Specialization
mastery.Master: A senior software engineer recognized as a leader within their specialty
mastery.Distinguished: A senior software engineer that has been recognized by their peers as a distinguished contributor

speciality.Generalist: General skills not associated with a specific specialty

tags.Article: A blog post or news article about a subject
tags.Lesson: A lesson, usually within a class
tags.User Guide: An official user guide or getting started guide
tags.UI/UX: Resource of interest for UI/UX Engineers
tags.API: Resource of interest for API Engineers
tags.Data: Resource of interest for Data Engineers
